fields.title: Nonprofit Sector Launched
fields.text: Subsidyscope releases data and analysis on various types of spending and subsidies in the nonprofit sector. Most federal subsidies come from tax expenditures; tax policies that benefit nonprofit organizations.

fields.title: Shifting Trends in Highway Funding
fields.text: User fees make up a decreasing share of total funds spent on highways. "Non-user fees” are making up the difference. Read more »

fields.title: Boeing Benefits from Ex-Im Guarantees
fields.text: Long-term loan guarantees by the Export-Import Bank of the United States helped Boeing sell nearly $10 billion in airplanes abroad in fiscal years 2007 and 2008. Read more »

fields.title: Amtrak Route Performance Analyzed
fields.text:
Amtrak routes lost an average of $32 per passenger in 2008, four times higher than the loss calculated using Amtrak’s own figures.
See our analysis and Amtrak route map »

fields.title: Airport Grants Database Unveiled
fields.text: A new database allows users to find details on nearly $18 billion in grants for almost 19,000 airport projects over the past five years. Search Grants »

fields.title: Aviation
fields.text: Taxes on airline tickets, fuel and freight are used to build airports and subsidize air service in small communities. Read more »

fields.title: Transportation Sector Launched
fields.text: More than $45 billion in federal transportation spending during fiscal year 2008 went to programs that contain subsidies. Read more »

fields.title: Watch Our Screencast
fields.text: Searching federal subsidy programs can be confusing; our screencast will remove the mystery. Watch it now »

fields.title: Nonprofit Sector Launched
fields.text: Subsidyscope releases data and analysis on various types of spending and subsidies in the nonprofit sector. Most federal subsidies come from tax expenditures; tax policies that benefit nonprofit organizations.

fields.title: Where Are TARP Banks Located?
fields.text: Our interactive map explores the county-by-county geographic footprint of TARP recipients in terms of both assets and branches, and lets users compare that data to banks' lending activity.

fields.title: Explore LLP Comments
fields.text: The Legacy Loans Program attracted over 400 comments.  Use our tool to explore more than 750,000 words' worth  of opinions on the FDIC's new program.

fields.title: Highways
fields.text: The federal government spends vastly more on highways than on any other mode of transportation. Learn more »

fields.title: Tracking the Fed
fields.text: Keep tabs on the Fed's balance sheet, and see how it's ballooned during the bailout.

fields.title: Maritime
fields.text: Over three-quarters of the Maritime Administration's budget goes toward subsidizing the growth of the industry. Learn more »

fields.title: Rail
fields.text: Amtrak has been receiving an operating subsidy from Congress since 1971. Read more »

fields.title: Transit
fields.text: Ten transit systems account for nearly half of all federal transit funding; the rest is divided among 751 other systems. Read more »
